1113.content:
You went to bed a few minutes after 2 AM. It was only the first day after winter break and already you had a backbreaking amount of homework to tend to. Otherwise, the day had flown by without major incident. You could hardly remember your wish from that morning, but the feeling that spurred it still lingered as you took off your jeans and t-shirt, falling into bed with only your boxers on. College was just around the corner--you'd applied to a handful of schools. Most of them hadn't gotten back to you yet, and the two that did put you on their waiting list. Everything about your life felt uncertain. Your sister had just entered her freshman year of high school, and already, she seemed primed to succeed in every field she applied herself to. When Mom talked about her prospects, she mentioned Harvard and Yale, Brown and Princeton. Around you, Mom didn't talk about college. Whatever she said around your father or Jill, you doubted it amounted to much more than, "Jason will end up wherever he will end up." Perhaps she thought that you'd go to community college and muck around for two years, before getting your shit together and getting into a halfway-decent school. And maybe she was right.

But damn it, it'd be hard when all of your friends were going off to different parts of the country. You could keep in touch through Facebook, but somehow, you knew that as soon as they left, their lives would travel in different directions from yours and you'd never be able to recreate the brotherhood and camaraderie that carried you through high school. And where would you be? At the end of summer, would you be attending a university? Or would you be stuck in your hometown, working at a gas station and taking beginning math courses at the nearest community college, with no friends except the classmates you worked on projects with?

This was the fear that stuck with you as you fell asleep... for a second, you also thought of Sandra Wong, who had announced in first period class that she'd been accepted into UCLA. "Lucky bitch," you'd thought. The anger you felt toward her surprised you, but then again, she was a cheerleader. She had scholarships to do dance routines and cheer on footballers--she didn't even need to worry about her high school GPA. Who wouldn't envy her?

There were no dreams that night. You slept restfully, from 2 AM until your alarm clock went off. Upon waking, you felt like something was different. Something about you had changed: physically, mentally, you couldn't say. But straightaway, you noticed how strong you felt, flexible, agile. You sprung from bed with a lithe step and crossed the room toward your closet, but halfway there you stopped yourself. "What's going on?" you thought. And then you looked down...

A sharp pain in your arm causes you to quickly grasp your shoulder in response, a small groan of displeasure dispersing into the room. A few students look over at you for a moment. You wave your hand and mouth that "It's nothing." You smile for a moment as your caressing of your arm has seemed to stop the sudden pain. Your eyes have instinctively closed out of pain but one lid opening shows a few more students have turned towards you this time.

You try to wave it off as nothing but you take notice of your hand and arm and find that it seems to be a river in a sense. The skin is coursing but your hand is only trembling. It soon begins to almost bubble in a sense, your teeth clench from the pain.

"H--hey are you O.K!?" You hear. You try to answer but cannot get passed "I..."

"Mrs. Sorrack, something's wrong with Jason." A student broadcasts but you find that it nearly a waste of breath as full attention is quickly brought to your person as you scream out in agony. You slam your head to the desk, your arms wrapped tightly around your body. Every chip of your body stings with a fiery essence, no portion unchecked-- even your eyes. The questions and banter of the students all become undertones as your ears begin to ring very loudly. Your eyes begin to blur. You become too tired to even writhe in agony and just lay with your head on the desk, facing out. Your ragged breathing method continues even as the pain subsides.

You fail to see most of the students from your position but you wonder what girl is leaning her head so close to you that her hair is obscuring your view. 11312.content:
You hear the chatter of voices from a muffled distance and the light clanking of metal. Opening your eyes to a bright white light, you look about and take in fairly quickly that you're in a hospital. 'A hospital eh? I guess that pain was real.' You echo in your head. If you had the strength you would jump out of bed to ask questions or at least you assume you would.

You briefly strew your gaze over her but it wasn't until now that you begin to focus on the woman doctor who has been staring at you for as long as you have been conscious. She looks to be about 40, curly blond hair and a pretty large nose.

"You awake this time or do you plan on just mumbling and falling back to sleep again?" She asks, her hand already prompt to write down anything you say. Your voice cracks as you speak but unlike usual, it seems to stay at a higher level. "Ah, yeah, I'm awake." You tell her through your haze.

"How are you feeling?" She asks. You find it a good question as you haven't even had time to think about it. You push yourself up a little bit on the bed and take a brief look at yourself but find no oddities that weren't hidden by the white blanket.

"Hungry, tired and my whole body feels a bit... itchy or tingly rather I guess." You tell her, a small chuckle accompanying your abrupt ask for food.

"I see. And just to confirm your name is?" She questions. You can only assume she is going down the usual book procedure and don't question the confirmation of your identity. "Jason Farfield." Is your response. You notice she seems a bit intrigued in a way by your name which you find a bit odd. You bring a hand to your brow and begin rubbing a bit to try and force the small headache away. You become a bit entranced in the simplicity of your action, finding the skin texture a bit strange, even your eyebrows felt strange to you as you rubbed your head. Vis versa seems true as well, your hands felt different against your head and as you further the position of your hand you begin to notice why. Your hands seem small and by no means as pronounced as you are used to. They seem in a way dainty, even the nails seem to shine as if you had polished them. You shake your head in stupidity of the random inspection of your person but only find more oddities as long hair swiftly takes place in front of you-- even if only for a moment before receding. You grab it and feel it, it's soft and gentle and amazingly attached to your scalp.

"What is this? How long have I been out?" You abruptly ask the doctor. She takes a seat next to the bed. "You were brought in earlier today at about 10 A.M. Your teacher and a student came with you on the ambulance and provided us with some... interesting descriptions." She replies.

"Earlier today? Then why is my hair-- what kind of descriptions?" You ask, lifting yourself off the back of the bed. She flips through some of the pages of her notes before quoting your teacher...

"He started screaming and I found him writhing in pain on his desk. His whole body was moving and eventually he started to look different. He looked like the principal's daughter, Mary Turner." Your mouth is gaping and you begin to feel a bit queasy. "That's a joke right? You're telling me I look like Mary?" You scoff.

"I didn't get to talk to her much but the student who came with you was Mary. I must say, you do look just like her. If it wasn't for the hard evidence that the Turner family has no twin daughters, I would say this was all an elaborate joke. Couple that with your D.N.A matching exactly to Mary's and you have yourself a complete clone. That and leaving me speechless, I've never seen or heard of anything like this and I've been a doctor for 25 years." She tells you but only leaves you stunned. The lights flicker a little as you shake your head back and forth with an uncomfortable smile.

"This has to be a joke. Sure, I have long hair for some reason but there is no way I'm Mary's twin." You spout, more to try and convince yourself than her. However, the oddities all seem to be spiraling in on you as you take notice of the empty feeling between your legs. The feeling only furthers as you look into every metal object in the room to find distorted reflections of Mary. You try to get out of bed but cringe from the aches of your body and merely stumble back into the pillow.

"This can't be..." You say as you stare at the ceiling in a brief recollection. "What about my parents?" You ask suddenly.

"They are in the hospital. It took quite awhile to convince them that you are their son." She informs you. If you really look like Mary than you find it to no surprise that they would be skeptical.

"Can I get something to eat? My stomach is killing me." You ask in your weak disposition.

"Sure." She says, getting up. She leaves the room, hopefully to get your food, leaving you alone.

You stare up at the ceiling some more, hoping to blind yourself in the dim but numerous lights. "Mary huh? I guess if I'm Mary than I have her cute face, melodic voice and her hair-- which always parts in the middle, arcing high to fall at either side of her face and drifting lovely to her shoulders. Yeah right!" You dabble to yourself with a joking tone of both anger and fright. Fright that perhaps this is not as false as your common sense deems it.

A nurse eventually comes into the room and gives you some food which you happily devour. You feel as though you haven't eaten for weeks and the lingering hunger doesn't subside until your meal is almost finished. "Ah, so this is what actually having an empty stomach is like." You say to yourself. You stretch your arms high and to the sides, taking notice of the slim and quite either boyish or girlish features. "Not a spec of hair on them, let alone any muscle. Not that I was particularly hairy or jacked before but this is ridiculous." You observe.

You do wear a thin smile just from the relief of all the inner turmoil subsiding from your body's delight of having food to digest and energy to create. You decide to try your best to stand and find that the energy is there but the balance is not. You stumble and wobble about, grasping every medical object around you to steady yourself. You gaze down at yourself in disappointment and frustration. "Well let's just see if this is real..." You say as you bring a hand to your chest, surprisingly feeling a more plump version of your own chest. "O--oh..."

You peer beneath your loose garment to see two breasts-- which to you, look enormous but you have seen Mary from a third person before, she is more about a double B than anything else. "Still..." You begin to say as you continue to gaze at the two foreign attachments to your being. "They seem bigger in person."

The door swings open and you quickly disperse both your hands behind your back but nearly fall in response from the sudden lack of support. You gather your standing and focus on the doctor who has returned.

"Feeling better now that you have eaten?" She asks with a delicate smile.

"Very much so." You respond with a dim-witted smile or so you assume. Not until now have you noticed but you do hear the melodic voice more and more as you speak. 'I guess I really do have her voice. Guess I just needed some water to hear it better.' You assume.

"That's good to hear. While we as medical enthusiasts would love to keep you here and run tests on your very unusual case. You're free to go home if you're feeling fine. We just ask that if you feel anything odd that you call us and let us know." She explains.

You feel a bit pained by the response. "Wait wait wait. I turn into my classmate apparently-- a girl no less and you're telling me to just go home? Live my life?" You ask with a fiery tone. She shuffles her papers around a tad, perhaps her nervous inkling. "I'm sorry. I would like to say we know how this happened but we've already run several tests while you were asleep. This is a medical mystery at the moment and the first case we've ever heard of. However, your parents are the ones who stressed that you be released today. I would of liked for you to at least stay for a week or so." She conveys to you.

"Sounds more like magic to me." You jest with a sour lip. She laughs and responds with "I agree."

You look around the room and then at yourself, finding your bare legs and open back gown a bit too revealing even if you are a girl now. "So, I'm fine with going home but I don't suppose you have something that will fit me?" You ask. She points to a pile of clothes on a shelf which you are a bit embarrassed about not noticing. "Mr.Turner brought those in, I assume they are some of his daughter's clothing." She explains.

You shiver at the thought of the principal being involved in this. His giant stature has always been a bit of an intimidating factor, you always found him to be a bit of a drill sergeant in his strict and direct mannerisms. "So, Mary and the principal know about this? I wonder how that will go over..." You say-- more to yourself than her.

She smiles and responds despite your dislocated gaze. "Mr.Turner seemed a bit angry about it and Mary looked to be a bit more shocked than anything."

"Ah, goody..." You grumble.

You get yourself dressed in the clothing Mr.Turner brought, embarrassingly getting help from the doctor. "T--this has to be a joke!" You shout as you place the small pink hoodie over your head. "Skin tight jeans and a shirt that fairs no better and a pink tiny hoodie? Mr.Turner did this on purpose to embarrass me!" You rant. The woman laughs at your reaction and commends your good spirits. "At least you're fine in personality." She says. You smile a bit embarrassingly and look away in a blush. "Heh..."

"Your parents are in the waiting room, they have been for a few hours." She tells you abruptly.

"Oh, alright. I guess I'll be on my way then." You say as you begin to exit the room. You stop yourself for a moment and look at the woman. "By the way, what's your name?" You ask. She jumps a bit and scratches her head with a perplexed look. "I can't believe I didn't tell you. Kimberly Louvcha." She says.

"Ah, thanks for being such a nice doctor." You tell her. She reels her head forward a bit and wears a gentle smile. "Well, well, you're quite mature for your age and you're welcome. Now run along." She teases.

You feel a bit nervous as you close the distance between you and your parents. "I wonder how this will go over..."

I'm almost a midget." You mumble.

"Can we sort this out at home by chance?" You ask. Your father, seeming to have the same sense of shame as you agrees to take the situation elsewhere.

"You sure you're alright?" Your father asks as everyone gets in the car. You seat yourself in the back with your sister, brushing your hair out of your face. "Besides how bizarre I feel, I'm fine. I'm not in any pain or anything, at least not anything serious." You inform him.

"Alright, well that's good I suppose." He replies. Your mother furthers her annoyance by whining about how her son sounds like a girl. You let her repeated comments about your appearance or anything go without retorts. You find yourself looking in the rear view mirror quite a lot of the ride home, the first actual mirror that you have seen your reflection in clearly. It would seem that everyone in the world but you is not stupid as you most certainly look exactly like Mary. The only noticeable difference is that your hair is falling flat instead of having a very prominent and thick parting. You can't help but notice your sister eying you carefully. Any movement whether it be brushing your hair or rubbing your legs seems to arouse her intrigue of you.

Getting out of the car and into your home you immediately vacate to the bathroom with realization that you have had to really go for a long time. You dismiss any curiosity you may have for now and do it as dignified as you can but do take not of the very interesting feeling even the small touch to your new primary sexual part gave you.

The falling sun during the ride home should of been a good indicator but you only just now realized that it's 6 P.M. Your parents order pizza at your request as you really just want to eat and go to sleep. It's not until you're near ready to go to sleep that you think about how school will go, do you even have to go tomorrow?
113121.title: You continue towards your parents.

choices: She wants to go out with you. (As friends.)
1131212.content:
You decide that skipping school at least for one day is a must as you are by no means prepared to go to school like this. You open the door to your parents room and find them a bit too close for your casual entrance. They play it off like they were doing nothing and ask what you need.

"Umm... can I skip school tomorrow? I'm not exactly ready to go like this." You ask. They don't seem to even bother thinking about it and respond. "It's your decision."

"Alright, thanks. I'll be skipping tomorrow then." You inform them as you close the door to leave them to their deeds. You can't help but hear "I wonder what being the opposite gender is like." from your mother's muffled voice. You shake your head with a smile as you walk away. "It's something at the very least." You answer despite her absence.

In your room you discard of your clothing with the exception of the disgustingly cute panties Mr. Turner picked out. "Does he dislike me or just the fact that I happened to turn into his daughter?" You question with a dim smirk. You can't help but fondle if only briefly the new perky breasts that hang from your chest. "These honestly feel better on myself." You state with a dirty mind. You grab a random T-shirt out of your mess of a closet and put it on. "Guess this is the only way I can wear my old shirts now." You sigh. Though your mind dances on worries you find that you are more exhausted than you thought and fall asleep quickly.

You wake up the next morning and stammer yourself into the bathroom. You look unamused by your reflection but do believe this is the first time you have seen Mary look like such a mess. You undress and step into the shower. The water really brings emphasis back to the strange sensations of your new body as you find yourself blocking the waves of water from hitting your more sensitive areas. "Gah, it's like a new layer of skin. Everything is really sensitive." You exclaim with your arms instinctively covering your breasts. Massaging your body and all it's contours you really can't help but literally feel that Mary is a beautiful girl. "This feels good." You whisper. You feel a little hot but not just from the water and quickly finish up any business you have in the shower.

You wipe the bathroom mirror clear from the fog entirely so you can take full notice of Mary's beautiful reflection. You playfully bite your lip and toy with your nipples, if not the feelings itself, the vision of Mary looking so sexy is enough to make you hard. The feeling is more definitely different and you begin to wonder just how good it would feel to try out a woman's pleasure. You can't resist and take a finger to yourself. You moan with pleasure but quickly pull away with fright from the shocking experience. You want to continue but morals are all to good at badgering you.

Still dripping wet you grab a towel to cover yourself and begin drying yourself off. You find your long hair is not going to dry with just a towel and take out your mother's hair dryer. It works as the label says it would and soon your hair is silkier than it's ever been and clinging beautifully to your face. You poke your head in displeasure from the style though. "I guess her hair doesn't naturally have that full part. She still looks good though." You say.

You talk yourself back into your room and regretfully cloth yourself with the same tight outfit you had on yesterday. "Not like I have any other clothes around the house and I'm not too keen on wearing anything my sister wears." You state. You scratch your head as you wonder what to do and end up bringing yourself downstairs to eat something. You are a bit alarmed to see that it's already 12:12 P.M. "I guess I really slept." You say.

After making yourself something to eat the doorbell rings to your surprise. With both your parents at work and your sister at school, anyone who knows your family would know better than to show up now. That said, you assume it's someone looking for you. You open the front door and for a moment actually feel like you're staring into a mirror. So used to the surprise of seeing Mary's reflection you are more surprised by the presence of the real Mary who seems to be carrying a few large bags.

"Wow..." She says with a gaping mouth. She smiles a bit and lets herself into the house, looking you over in quite an enthusiastic method. "I mean, wow. I saw you when you changed and stuff and in the hospital but... seeing you up and about and stuff is amazing. You really look just like me." She exclaims as she circles about you.

"Uhh... yeah. I'm a bit... surprised by it too." You say in a surprising loss for words. You'd think this kind of thing would trigger all sorts of conversation tidbits.

"Ah, wait. What are you doing here? Isn't there school today?" You ask. She smiles and says. "Well daddy and I feel a bit responsible for this since you look just like me and stuff, so we decided to help out the best we can. I'm kind of glad this happened, I got daddy to buy me a whole new wardrobe while you get my old clothes." She explains. You look at the bags on the floor and wager that they are filled with clothing-- clothes you can't see yourself wanting to wear.

"Ah, so where's your room?" She asks. You take her to your room where she plants down all her bags and starts layering things out on your bed. You kind of stumble back as she starts pulling clothes out of the bags in rapid succession. "Here's your skirts, pants, shorts, shirts, tops, sneakers, heels, a coat, lingerie, a few pairs of stockings, bras and stuff. Some of it is new, some of it is my old stuff. Since you look like me I can guarantee this will fit. You feel like your head is spinning as you look at all the clothing. She wastes no time as she begins to remove what little clothes you actually keep in your closet with her own. You rub your temples with a backwards grin. 'She's so nice but she's so... unstoppably weird.' You voice to yourself.

"So, you're not angry or anything about me looking exactly like you?" You ask. She doesn't turn around and just continues to navigate herself around your room with her clothing. "Well, at first I was a little scared but I found I just couldn't be mad about it. You were writhing in pain and stuff, I'd be a total dummy if I was mad at you for something like this." She conveys to you which brings a delightful sense of relief. Truthfully, you were quite scared about how reactions could vary and end quite undesirable. She turns her head to you as she finishes up and smiles. "I want to help as much as I can. You're a boy and stuff so I'm sure you are probably having a hard time. If I suddenly turned into a boy I'd be completely lost. So think of me as a sisterish kind of person, I know more about you than you do right now." She says.

"That's true. Thanks Mary." You reply with a whole-hearted smile.

"Don't mention it. Now have a seat." She says, pointing towards the chair near your desk. You shrug and sit down just to see as to why. She pulls out a mirror and places it onto your desk, along with that she pulls a bunch of things out of the bag that just make you cringe. "Now this is your lip balm..." She begins as she presses it against your lips. You instinctively press your lips together when she is finished and find the sweet taste of watermelon on your lips. "Mmm. I love watermelon." You say.

"Me too! Anyways, I lick mine off because it tastes good but you probably only need to apply it a few times a day." She explains.

She continues more and more with both demonstrations of each individual piece of make-up. You would like to stop her and tell her that just because you look like a girl now by no means means you're going to dress and act like one but you feel it would hurt her nothing but helpful tangent so you keep quiet.

"Now here's how you do my hair." She says as she grabs some of your hair and places it against her curling iron. "Get it in a good position and then spray." She explains as she sprays your hair. "Don't use too much or it'll be sticky. Now you do the other side. This really makes my bangs look good." She says. You regretfully comply and do the other side of your hair.

"So, I feel a bit bad that your father bought all these clothes. He's doesn't even know me." You say. She continues to play with your hair and says "Don't worry about it, my families not too bad off."
1131212.title: Ask if you can skip it.

11312122.content:
With your hair made up in it's surprisingly simple method and your face complete with foreign substances you can't deny the uncanny likeness you have of Mary. Rather, you look exactly like her, the same way you have seen her for as long as you have known her. Which isn't that long-- quite frankly you haven't even talked to her much at all prior to this moment. "I can't say I haven't wanted to..." You whisper.

"What?" She asks. You get out of the chair and turn towards her with a shaking hand. "It's nothing." You assure her. She looks at you and with twitching fingers proclaims "It's a bit creepy! You are really me from top to bottom." A bit guilt ridden due to your stolen appearance and her obsessive aid, you plea for forgiveness with a toppling head. She places her hands gently on your shoulders and shakes you violently. Surprised, you step back and shout "W--what was that for!?" She giggles a bit and tells you "Sharon always does that to me whenever I'm feeling down. I thought since you look like me I'd try the same thing."

You contort your face in as best a way you can manage to convey your 'I dunno how to react to that' response. "Uhh, I think I just look like you. I dunno if being shaken violently is going to make me giggle or something." You relay to her. She just smiles with a small chuckle. Her continual gentle stare is surprisingly strong enough to make you turn away in embarrassment.

"Say, are you hungry or anything?" She asks suddenly. You feel your stomach for some reason and reply that you are.

"Want to go out for something to eat then?" She asks. You realize it may be out of context but just the fact she is technically asking something that could qualify as a date makes you blush. "Uh... s--sure. Where to?" You stammer.

"I'd like to go to a restaurant and catch up on breakfast if that's O.K. I kind of skipped it." She suggests. You are pleased that she isn't just going to ask what you want and tell her "That's fine with me."

You feel as though you are a bit overly enthusiastic as you step into her car. You can't say that you haven't thought of Mary as a potential partner so even being this close is a bit unexpected. As the car starts onto the road, Mary speaks up in a curious tone. "So hey. What's it like being me and stuff?"

You twitch and look down at yourself, gently tugging on your small pink hoodie. "Umm..." You mumble.

'How am I supposed to respond to that!? I can't say anything bad or she'll think I think her body sucks!' You rage. You brush your hair behind your ears and give a nervous smile. "How do I describe it? I feel... I don't know. Different." You rattle out in probably one of your most uninformative attempts at answering a question to date.

"I know that but what's it feel like? I've been me forever, so I'm not sure how being me would feel to someone else or something like that. Tell me the differences and stuff." She asks.

"Uhh, let's see. Can I just say all the feelings I have as bluntly as I can?" You query. She replies that "Anything is fine." You take a deep breath with a bit of an anxious grin, as perhaps you have wanted to speak up about this for awhile.

"My whole body feels weird. I'm like 10 inches shorter, my hands are tiny and my fingers are too short. I can't touch any part of my body without questioning if it's mine or not. Smiling, frowning, every expression let's me feel how different my face is. It all contours differently. My body is so overly sensitive and these clothes are so tight. Every movement I make reminds me that I'm missing my... manhood. Being a girl is strange..." You rattle out in an uproar of minuscule details. Mary seems a bit delighted by your tangent as her eyes are wide with a bright smile.

"Hehe. Sounds like fun." She teases.

"My voice is too high and melodic and my hair is too long..." You grumble.




As you walk into the restaurant you get quite a few stares from both fellow customers and employees. While twins aren't really rare, it would seem Mary and you are too similar for your own good. Mary plays it off as such-- that you're her twin and regretfully you go along with it as you can't deny it's the only excuse that could work. "I guess telling them that I'm a boy who turned into my classmate wouldn't go over well." You mumble. Mary agrees with a laugh, despite you not wanting anyone to hear your outspoken thoughts.

Sitting at the table with Mary is a bit picturesque. To you, you feel as though you're on a date with her but as you look down at your small feminine hands both loosely holding utensils, you sigh. You look into the window and see your reflection and Mary's as well. 'I guess to everyone but me. This is just two twin sisters eating breakfast in the afternoon. Great...' You whine. Though you regret that even Mary herself probably doesn't see this as anything, you are a bit grateful that you have no girlfriend at the moment. "I wonder how a girlfriend would respond to this?" You say in a daze.

"You have a girlfriend?" Mary asks with curious eyes. You pinch your legs through your tight jeans as punishment for speaking your thoughts but swiftly respond. "No, just wondering how one would react if I had one."

With eyes of serious thought and a smile of the opposite effect, she raises a finger to her face in thought. "Well, if I was your girlfriend it would be particular awkward. I'm not sure if I could ever date myself and stuff. I think your typical girl would dump their boyfriend if he turned into a girl. Most high school couples just don't last anyway." She says. You find her opinion rather insightful and brutally honest. If you were dating a girl and she turned into a man, you can't say with a straight face that you would continue to date her.

"Yeah. I guess I should be lucky I'm not in a relationship." You say.

The rest of the evening with her is lovely and you find yourself really enjoying her presence. You can't describe how badly you wish you were a boy again so you could officially ask her out. Sadly, you enter your home only with her number and her sisterhood as she calls it.

"Where have you been?" Your mother screams in a panic as you walk into the kitchen.

"Mary came over and we went out for something to eat." You respond. Your sister finishes putting her really long blond hair up in a ponytail and says "That's the principal's daughter right? The cutey you supposedly turned into right?"

"What did she want?" Your mother demands with her arms folding with great ferocity the moment any mention of your change is spoken. You don't hide the anger you acquire from both your mother's accusing tone and your sister's constant irritating tone.

"Would you stop being angry at everyone who was there?" You request. Your mother moves her plump exterior around the kitchen table to confront you.

"The fact you turned into this girl makes me think she has something to do with it." She states.

"She is a nice girl, besides, how would she t-- why would she turn me into herself?" You ask with little intent to hear an answer as you walk passed her.

In-closed in your room, you disperse a bit of your anger just by ranting to yourself. "Yeah, sure. I guess it makes sense that she would suspect Mary but... how could she even do this? Guess it doesn't matter right now..."

"You don't want to go on your bus or something?" She asks with a playful tip of her head. Thinking it over a bit you feel the relief is more from that than the comforting heat. "Pretty much. I'm not sure how this day is going to go over." You reply.

"Umm... I guess that's fine. I don't to make you uncomfortable by pretending to be you or anything." You answer.

"Alright, thank you." She says with a smile as you gets out of the car. You follow her like a pet, nervously looking to side to side. The people arriving to the school don't seem to notice the twins walking together but as you enter the school the stares begin to take place. Some of them do double takes. Your head sinks to the floor in embarrassment and you decide to split apart from Mary. "I--I'm just gonna head straight to class." You say as you scurry off in a power walk. Normally you'd take your sweet time before going to your class but today is a race against being noticed-- you have a good feeling it will be harder than dodging rain.

"Hey Mary." A cute girl says to you with a wave who you recognize as Kimberly. "Hey..." You respond. "I don't suppose you can let me borrow your math homework?" She asks quite quickly. She tries to abuse puppy dog eyes as best she can you find it to be working as you stutter to respond. "I uhh... I have to go." You blurt out as you zoom passed her.

You drive into your classroom and place your head swiftly into your desk so no one can notice your face. "I'll just leave my head buried in my arms for the whole day, people will just think I'm some girl instead Mary." You say into your shirt, muffling any hope of others hearing it. As you stare to your side you can see your brown hair falling gently, clinging loosely and moving smoothly to any movements you make. The similar scene from when this first happened flashes into your head and you smile out of stupidity. "I guess that was my hair all along..." You mutter.

You can hear the footsteps of people as they enter the room so you shut your eyes in hope no one notices you.

"Mary?" You hear.

"God dammit..." You grumble with an uncontrollable smile from your easily thwarted attempts to hide yourself. You lift your face from the comfort of your soft sleeves to reveal yourself to the class.

"What are you doing here?" You hear once more. You turn your head and just smack yourself in the face in utter defeat as you see who it is. 'How did I forget that Sharon was in this class...? A.K.A. Mary's best friend to which I only learned yesterday!' You scold your stupidity as your hand slides down your face.

"How did you change your clothes so fast?" She asks yet another question to which you're sure there are a hundred that could follow. Her tilting head and bewildered expression are distracting, both because it makes her look innocent and that it makes you stumble over how to respond.

"Uhh... how do I say this? You'll find out soon enough, so just take your seat." You tell her.

"Hell does that mean?" She snaps back but quickly continues with "Whateva..." and turns towards her seat. As she sits back down she continues to wear a foul expression, her arms and legs folded. "She's easily angered isn't she?" You mumble.

The class starts soon enough but it's only moments in that the announcements come on and regretfully, the end of the announcements are followed by the principal.

"This is a special announcement so pay attention and I stress that this is 100% true. I'm sure some of you may have noticed that there were 2 Mary Turners in school today..." He begins. You grasp your head with your shaking hands, the smooth touch of Mary's hair doing little do distract you.

"While physically this may look to be the case, I can assure you I only have one daughter. The other is Jason Farfield who at approximately 10:24 A.M. went under a severe and unexplainable medical phenomena. The results are as shown, he is a striking resemblance to my daughter but don't mistake the fact that there is only one Mary Turner. Please treat him as you would before his perplexing medical condition. Thank you."

"God dammit, god dammit, god dammit. He sounds like a damn sergeant-- dammit-- dammit." You mumble with your eyes facing the desk, your hands nervously grasping your head. Humbly, you raise your head to the perplexed class who are staring at you so intently that you feel they could cut right through you. You give a nervous laugh but as it rings so lonely you feel embarrassed already. You begin to get a bit angry just from the sheer lack of communication and shout "Stop staring at me!"

"You're... not... Mary?" Sharon is the first to speak up, that is if you don't include the muffled "Is this for real?" or "Is that some kind of joke?" you hear from other classrooms.

The pressure of the room really begins to get to you as you stand up to speak but almost begin to cry as you begin. "I'm not..." You stop to compose yourself if only a little. "I'm Jason-- so what if I'm a girl! Now stop staring at me!" You cry out and quickly re-immerse yourself into your arms. You feel pitiful as your tears soak into the dark green cloth. You feel that despite your coverage that any sensible human being could notice from your shivering body that you're crying and as a man, doing so in front of so many people you feel can never be redeemed.

The silence seems to stop and the students all begin asking you questions but you just ignore them and leave your head down. The teacher eventually tells them to leave you alone. The whole class you lay there as to not see any of the stares despite your awareness that they are staring at you even with your head down.

The bell does eventually ring which forces you to get up from your solemn state. Of course the stares are still there you just continue to ignore them with an unchanging frown on your face. Even the packed hallways offer no relief as anyone who knows who Mary is, is gazing at you like you're some sort of walking science experiment.

Curly brown hair went down your back falling naturally into place. The clothes are you back were tight, only to be replaced by a red satin gown.

"Why am I up so early?" you thought and headed back to sleep.

You awoke again. The clock now said 5:00 am.

Never had you craved it before, but for some reason you just needed to go. Without even changing your clothes, you opened the front door and started to run.

As you ran, you started to become more conscious of yourself. A distinct bounce on your chest became more and more apparent. A cool breeze tickled your bare, hairless legs and sending a shiver through your body.

It clicked.

"What happened to my body? What am I wearing?" You asked aloud still running. It looked very familiar, but the shock was preventing you from quite putting your finger on it. Then it hit you. It was Bridgett Appleford.

You recoiled back onto your butt.

"Ow, that really hurt... sorry I'm bad at looking where I'm going. Sometimes, when I'm focused I stop paying attention."

In front of you was Bridgett Appleford.

12121.content:
January 2010


Jason dazed off in the middle of his Math class, which was after English class where he muttered his wish. He wasn't able to sleep well last night, marathoning the 2nd season of Breaking Bad for more than 9 hours straight, into midnight. He discovered the show back in October when his friend recommended it to him, saying it was riveting and strange. Jason was hooked ever since, but only yesterday was he able to lazily finish torrenting every episode. His sister Jill wasn't all that happy having her brother stay up late like this, but she knew that he has been waiting for his chance to start downloading as soon as they return from their week-long visit to their grandparents' home. He barely survived all the talks about how America should have been like it was when JFK was president ("Nowadays we have these crackpots who constantly take all our hard-earned cash for themselves. Look at how they made our economy bankrupt! When we were told that the US can handle the Soviets, we knew that we can handle the Soviets...").
         As soon as the bell rang to signal lunchtime, Jason lifted his heavy head to see Mr. Miller telling the class to prepare... something... he didn't quite get what he said, still groggy from his nap. He picks up his navy blue backpack, lays the straps around his shoulders, then heads for the exit, when he noticed Mr. Miller glance at him; he looked annoyed, not irritated, but annoyed, as if he constantly has these types of students in his class. Jason nervously smiled back at him, continuing to do so as he leaves the room.
         Along the hallway, he sees his pal Wes, who was with him during Math class. He runs up to him, eager to ask a question.
         "Hey, Wes," said Jason.
         "Yeah?"
         "What did Mr. Miller say when Math was finished?"
         "He said to bring a compass for drawing, since he'll start Trigonometry next meeting. I saw you were asleep again."
         "Yeah, but I can't help it. Marathoned Breaking Bad last night, and it was awesome, you should try it sometime, y'know."
         "Will do, but I'll just pick up the DVD when it comes out."
         "All right, you will just have a blast, man, watching the best show on television." Jason begins jogging towards the school entrance.
         "If I don't?" asked Wes loudly across the hall.
         Jason turns around and replies "Sue me!", finishing their conversation.
         With his allowance of 15 bucks from his parents, he plans to order take-out from a fast food restaurant then head back home to pick up his PE uniform he forgot to bring with him. Humming "Negro y Azul  " under his breath, he heads towards his Honda Civic at the parking lot at the side of his school. Halfway through, he is suddenly greeted by a barrage of students walking along the lot, which he hadn't noticed while at the exit of the school. A flurry of whites, reds, yellows, greens, and blues from the students' clothes constantly crossed his line of vision. Jason tries to navigate through the crowd, trying to avoid the bags and shoulders of each student making their way, to no avail. He is continually nudged, pushed, and shoved by the stream of teens, so much so that he eventually forgot what direction he was headed. He scans his surroundings, and sees some of the faces of the crowd, a few he thought he recognized, but most of the others he didn't. He has now reached a point where he's just desperate to get to his car, trying to shove others out of the way to where he thinks his car is, until he notices a small yet heavy-looking brown duffel bag coming towards him. He barely glimpses its appearance until it blows him right at the side of his head, which knocks him out...
         Kaleidoscopic images appear before Jason in a chaotic yet beautiful manner: the duffel bag from earlier comes out of a hole in a tree at the forest, transforming into a green blob-like creature with a hand inside its body, a clown dressed as a lawyer appears out of the tree and starts singing "Oh how I wish I could have taken up law," the grass reveals a red bowler hat out of which comes a rat dressed in a suit, running towards a dragon's skull which it made into a home, and an empty glass box which has an inscription reading "Seize the day". Looking at them all, he's just bewildered at what he is seeing. He then tries to run away from the forest to a plain white landscape, seeing many Rambo clones along the way. They are firing away their guns toward his direction, yet curiously he isn't hurt by any of their shots. As soon as he reaches the white landscape, he hears a voice which seems oddly familiar to him. It says repeatedly, with a tinny sort of sound like a cheap recording, "I wish I was you." It's his own voice, he thinks, which isn't voluntarily coming from him. He is now starting to feel hysterical, running in distress from what he thinks is his dream towards a lone, plain-looking, blue door. As soon as he opens it, he is assaulted by a swarm of disembodied hands and feet rushing out of the door, piling on top of him until he is fully covered.
         Jason suddenly woke up from the dream, yelling from the shock for a bit, then breathing heavily, already sitting upright as if he wasn't even lying down while sleeping. He immediately scanned his surroundings, finding out that for some reason, he is at the cafeteria. He then notices some students who are looking at him funny, most likely from his shout. Jason slows his breath down, for his nightmare was over. As soon as he calms himself, he sees and stares at a meal that seems to have been barely eaten by someone. After seeing this, he feels a metallic object in his hand, which he sees is a red iPod Classic, but then he notices something off: his hands look different. It looks slender and very smooth, not at all like his own hand, as well as having fingernails with pink nail polish. He almost gets sick of the thought of having "very girly" nail polish, when he notices the rest of his body: he now has the slender body of a girl, and instead of his red shirt, he is wearing a cheerleader's uniform. Highly shocked at what he is seeing, he tries to keep his sanity intact by trying to convince himself it is all still a dream. "No," Jason thinks to himself, "this all feels too real. My previous dream was just insane, while this... feels like the real thing, just that I'm the only one who's changed. What's the word people used to describe something like this?" The word Jason is trying to find is Kafkaesque.
         Jason gradually begins hyperventilating again. He couldn't grasp at how he transferred to the cafeteria and transformed into a girl. He doesn't know what to do next. All the sounds of squeaking shoes, clinking spoons and forks, and chatter blur together, numbness creeping all over him as he stumbles a bit while getting off the chair. While he lurches forward towards the exit, students are momentarily halting what they're doing to witness what was happening to the cheerleader freaking out and trying to walk fast yet stumbling to the door. As soon as Jason reaches the door, he notices two to three teachers now heading towards the cafeteria, most likely hearing from others that a student seems to be in distress. Jason is in distress, but he could as well find out what happened to himself on his own, for maybe as soon as he tells them what happened, they might think he's insane and dismiss the situation, or worse: send him to a mental hospital. Or help him get his body back, but what can they do? All he can do now is hope that everything will be fine.

You suddenly got really disoriented, but it passes just as fast as it came. Quite a few now things different to you. For one, you were now in a different seat. You had been sitting next to the windows, but you now were located around the middle. Sandra was an attractive half-Chinese girl. She was pretty popular too, with being a cheerleader, as well as having good grades. And despite her popularity, she wasn't a bitch like that Betty Jackson, and was a nice person. You also had a crush on her since middle school, and she lived like ten blocks away from you with her mother. And although not often, you had talked with her on occasion, and she had always been nice to you. You had even been paired up with her for a project last year.

Breaking away from you thinking about how much you liked her, you then notice that she is no longer wearing what she had been moments before as she stood at the front of the class. Now she was wearing exactly the same stuff you were wearing, from the red shirt you were wearing to the jeans. Even the sneakers.

That then drew your attention to the other thing that felt different. Your own clothes now felt wired, and when you looked down, you found out exactly why. You were now dressed like a girl! You were wearing a short sleeve blouse and a skirt. You also saw that your fingernails were painted with pink nail polish. Now despite your odd appearance, no one was paying you any mind. They would see you as they looked around the room due to boredom from the lesson, but not even spare you a second glance as if your appearance was completely natural. Now you weren't the most rugged or masculine of men, but there was no way you could be mistaken for a girl. Fearing the worst, you reach down and feel your crotch and are relieved to find your little friend still present, but that only raises more questions.

It is then that you realize that the clothes you are now wearing were the same ones that Sandra had been wearing until just a while ago. You then look over again to where Sandra was now sitting, remembering she is now dressed like you. You confirm that that not only is she now dressed like you, but that the clothes she is wearing are yours, after noticing a few minor specific details. You then look down at yourself, and wonder something. While you are not the biggest of guys, you are at least slightly bigger than Sandra, enough so that you wouldn't fit into her clothes, yet they seem to fit you perfectly.

You are tapped on the shoulder, and some one asks "Hey Sandra, are you okay? You don't look like you feel well." It was one of Sandra's friends, and for some reason she had addressed you as Sandra.

"Huh?" you let out, not hiding your confusion at the situation. 'Why did she just call me Sandra?' you thought to yourself.

Seeming to mistake the reason of your confusion, she said "You've been looking worried for a while. Do you need to go to the nurse?"

Deciding you wanted to get out of class to think about what was going on, you say "Um, no, I'm alright. But I think I need to use the bathroom real quick."

"Alright, but if somethings wrong, don't hide it girl." she said.

While you are bit bothered by being referred to as a girl, you shrug it off and raise your hand. Your teacher Ms. Sorrack sees and asks "Yes Sandra?"

'Her too?' you thought. You glance over to see the real Sandra look at the teacher in confusion at hearing her name. "Can I please use the bathroom?" you ask. Sandra looks over at you, shock evident on her face.

"Yes, you may. Just don't take too long."

You get up to leave, and are relieved that you weren't wearing heels. You left, and as you made your way to the bathroom, you pass a few people in the hall. None of them acted as if anything was wrong with you, and one said hi to you. As you neared the bathroom, you were making you way to the boy's restroom out of habit, but before you passed the girl's restroom, another girl exited, and figuring you needed to use the bathroom, she held the door open for you. With everything that is going on, you decided to enter, and thank her.

After making sure that you were the only one in there, you looked into the mirror, and you saw your normal reflection, albeit in girl's clothes, and with make-up on your face. You then inspected yourself further, discovering your ears were now pierced and had earrings in them, your legs and everywhere else had been shaved, and you were even wearing a bra and panties. Like the rest of your clothes, these seemed to fit you perfectly, despite not even having breasts for the bra to support.

Just then, the door opened, and someone else walked in. "Hey Sandra." the girl said. It was one of her friends, but you couldn't remember her name at the moment, so you just responded with a hi back.

Deciding to check further, you ask the girl "Hey, how does my hair look? I'm wondering if I should get a haircut soon."

"It looks fine Sandra. You should grow your short hair out a bit more, and get some highlights that go great with your brown hair." she says.

You look back to your own reflection, acting as if you're thinking about your hair. And while you were in a way, not for the reason the girl thought. Your own hair was short, while Sandra's hair was long and went down to her mid back. Not only that, but Sandra's own hair was black, much darker than you're own brown hair. "Yeah." you said. As you made your way back to your classroom, you thought about what was going on. You were in your own body, yet you were dressed like Sandra, and even though you still looked the same as you always did, everyone was treating you like her. As you got back to class, you saw Sandra look over at you. You also saw your best friend Alex lean over and say something to her. You caught a few words as you sat back down, and you guessed he was talking about your crush on her. You also heard her play along. So not only were you being treated like Sandra, but she was being treated as if she was you. It was almost as if you two had swapped lives or something. info.brief_description: You wind up experiencing someone else's life after a wish taken too literally
info.description:
You are sitting in class when you wish to be someone else. Your wish is taken literally and you wind up as them by either morphing into a copy of them, swapping bodies with them or swapping lives with them*.

Your name is Jason Farfield, you are 18 and have a younger sister name Jill.

Some basic rules:
1. No killing the main character
2. No personality changes
3. Try to keep good grammar
4. No other wishes that come true or powers

Swapping lives with someone means that you keep your body but everyone acts as though you had always led their life. you gain their parents, friends, boyfriend/girlfriend, job, school grades. Both involved in the swap notice the changes about the way people are acting but no one else does.

There is a diner that may show up, at this diner work Ben (as chef) & Viola (as the waitress). Also at the diner is Doug, an older man who is almost always there, eating soup. The diner will only ever come into play when the main character is in desperate need of help or guidance or is simply lost. At no other time will they run across the diner. Try to not over use it.

Doug may show up at other times to lend a hand but again, do not overuse him.

Most importantly of all... HAVE FUN!!!
